div.p: Carton no. 12, Melbourne, consulat, Serie A, Centre des Archives Diplomatiques, Nantes.
For a printed version of this letter, see Home & Maroske (1997), p. 23. Melbourne

Let me express my best thanks, dear Consul Dejardin, for your attentive kindness of sending me the Number of the Ministerial Bulletin for Agriculture, containing the valuable Report on the Wattle-Bark of this colony, furnished by Mons. Maistre.
This publication has not been identified. Pray convey to him my best acknowledgement for the generous manner, in which he referred to myself on this occasion.
I have retained the publication here for the present; but doubtless it is your only impression; so I will return it in a few days.

At present I have a quarto volume under progress on salsolaceous plants, giving lithographic illustrations of the various Australian species, rather more than 100; so that the best kinds for sheep-pastures in saline regions of mild climes might be easily recognized.
The first two decades of M's Iconography of Australian salsolaceous plants were published in 1889 (B89.13.04).

When the work shall have been completed, some impressions will be offered for your friendly acceptance, as the naturalisation of some species will doubtless become of great importance for some tracts of Country in Southern France, Algeria and Tunis.
